text: thumb|right|250px| A medical laboratory or clinical laboratory is a laboratory where tests are usually done on laboratory specimens. This is to get information about the health of a patient. Labs perform tests on tissue, blood and other body fluids.Barbara H Estridge; Anna P Reynolds; Norma J Walters, Basic Medical Laboratory Techniques" (Albany, NY: Delmar Publishers, 2000), p. 4 Medical labs analyze data in five major categories. These are chemistry, immunology, hematology, microbiology and transfusion medicine. == References == Category:Healthcare
title: Medical laboratory
